page.title: 06QUARRYING
page.content: The last ICE AGE left deposits of sand and gravel within the area, as well as the more widespread clays. Today quarrying occurs in GRID squares 3875, 3874, 3873, 3773. {Steetley Quarries}are at present extracting sand and gravel for the local building industry. The sand is worked, washed, sorted and then sold using 15 operatives. More recently the quarry has begun to mix and sell{Readymix Concrete,}buying in cement powder from elsewhere. Large areas of former quarry workings have had the topsoil replaced and have been returned to agriculture. Still more old workings have been bought by {WARNACT}to preserve them as wildlife habitats.{Wetlands and woodlands}have been preserved in this way. The quarry owners and workers have helped to reclaim and to preserve.
